string.doc: String for denoting an electron-type anti-neutrino.
String for denoting the arrow matrix solver.
String for denoting the wing width for the arrow matrix solver.
String for denoting the average electron neutrino energy.
String for denoting the average electron anti-neutrino energy.
String for denoting a baryon.
String for denoting the nuclide XPath for the base evolution.
String for denoting the reaction XPath for the base evolution.
String for denoting the XPath for a beta minus reaction.
String for denoting the XPath for a beta plus reaction.
String for denoting the chemical potential divided by kT.
String for denoting the temperature derivative of the chemical potential divided by kT.
String for specifying an equilibrium cluster abundance constraint.
String for denoting the chemical potential / kT of an equilibrium cluster.
String for an XPath expression specifying an equilibrium cluster.
String denoting the derivative of pressure with respect to temperature.
String denoting the time step in an evolution calculation.
String denoting an electron.
String for denoting the XPath for an electron capture reaction.
String denoting entropy per nucleon.
String denoting exposure (in inverse millibarns).
String denoting the initial abundance.
String denoting flow current.
String denoting the forward flow.
String giving a flag for the GNU scientific library.
String giving a flag to evolve the abundances in a zone with NSE plus weak reaction rates.
String giving the number of elements to drop in the ilu preconditioner.
String giving the key_string below which to drop key_strings in the ilu preconditioner.
String denoting the initial abundance.
String denoting the internal energy density (ergs/cm^3).
String containing the name of the iterative solver to be used.
String denoting the name of the iterative solver convergence method to be used.
String denoting whether to debug iterative solutions.
String denoting the maximum number of iterations in an iterative solution.
String denoting the relative tolerance for convergence of an iterative solution.
String denoting the absolute tolerance for convergence of an iterative solution.
String denoting the temperature (in 10^9 K) below which to use the iterative solver.
String for denoting the laboratory rate of a (typically weak) reaction.
String for denoting the temperature (in 10^9 K) below which to switch over to the laboratory rate for a (typically weak) reaction.
String for denoting the factor by which a (typically weak) rate switches over to the laboratory rate.
String for indicating below which negative abundance a calculation will throw an error.
String for denoting the log10 ft key_string of a weak rate.
String for denoting the log10 of the rate of a reaction.
String for denoting the log10 of the product of the electron fraction Ye and the density (in g/cc).
String denoting the Mach number.
String denoting the electron chemical potential.
String denoting the proton chemical potential.
String denoting the neutron chemical potential.
String denoting the electron neutrino chemical potential.
String denoting the net flow for a reaction. Could this be replaced?
String denoting the electron neutrino.
String for denoting the minimum abundance to consider for Newton-Raphson convergence. Default?
String for denoting the error to consider for Newton-Raphson convergence. Default?
String for denoting a particle.
String for denoting a photon.
String for denoting a positron.
XPath expression for selecting a positron capture reaction.
String for denoting the pressure.
String for denoting the initial radius.
String for denoting the current radius.
String for denoting a view for a rate modification.
String for denoting a factor (e.g., that by which to multiply rates for reactions in a rate modification view).
String for denoting the XPath expression to select nuclides.
String for denoting the XPath expression to select reactions.
String for denoting the reverse reaction flow.
String for denoting the current density.
String for denoting the initial density.
String for denoting the cell density. This must be changed. It is used (barely) in the shock code but probably collides with simple_snII.
String for denoting the matrix solver.
String for denoting the minimum abundance not to be zeroed out.
String for denoting the minimum rate key_string not to be zeroed out.
String for denoting the specific heat per nucleon.
String for denoting a specific abundance--usually for a species whose abundance is held constant.
String for denoting a specific species--usually one whose abundance is held constant.
String for denoting the frequency of time steps to print out.
String for denoting the cell temperature. This must be changed. It is used (barely) in the shock code but probably collides with simple_snII.
String for denoting thermo quantities or functions.
String for denoting the end time for an evolution calculation.
String for denoting the density e-folding timescale.
String for denoting the e-folding timescale for the neutrino luminosity.
String for denoting the XPath expression to select nuclides for a thermo quantity calculation.
String for denoting the current time in a evolution calculation.
String for denoting the total contribution to a quantity.
String for denoting two-dimensional weak rates computed directly.
String for denoting two-dimensional weak rates computed froom the log10 ft key_string.

string.key_string: [user_rate/@key = 'two-d weak rates log10 ft' or user_rate/@key = 'two-d weak rates']
string.doc: XPath expression for selecting 2-d weak rates.
String for denoting the current temperature (in 10^9 K).
String for denoting the initial temperature (in 10^9 K).
String for denoting whether to use the approximate weak rates.
String for denoting whether to use NSE correction.
String for denoting whether to use screening.
String for denoting whether to use weak detailed balance.

string.key_string: weak view for lab rate transition
string.doc: String for denoting the weak view to select nuclei needing a transition to lab rates.

string.key_string: [reactant = 'electron' or product = 'electron' or reactant = 'positron' or product = 'positron']
string.doc: XPath expression to select weak reactions.
String to denote the electron-to-nucleon ratio
String to denote the mass in a zone.
String to denote the change in the mass in a zone.
